page_title_en: Rocket Leagues Octane Is Now Driveable In Fortnites Battle Royale Mode
page_description_en: The iconic Rocket League vehicle looks to be making the jump from Fortnite's creative mode to battle royale proper.
page_text_html:
Update: As of the new Fortnite update, Octane is now found within the game's battle royale mode. The vehicle comes equipped with all the stunt abilities you'd expect from a Rocket League car, including jumping and double-jumping, rocket-boosting, flipping, and driving on walls. A slew of in-game challenges are available for those who want to earn free Rocket League items for Fortnite--and free Fortnite items for Rocket League and Rocket League Sideswipe.

Original story: Rocket League's Octane landed in Fortnite in early October as part of a collaboration between two games both owned by Epic. The vehicle is currently only available in Fortnite's creative mode, but tweets made by both Fortnite and Rocket League suggest that the Octane might be appearing in battle royale this week.

A video posted to both Fortnite and Rocket League's Twitter accounts shows a vehicle from a Rocket League match disappearing into a rift, a visual that's been used in the past to promote Fortnite's numerous crossovers.

From Champions Field to the Island… 11.15.2022 pic.twitter.com/PyQtCHZrpg

— Fortnite (@FortniteGame) November 14, 2022

The Octane has already been available in Fortnite's creative mode, giving players an advance look at its special abilities, which include a wall-climbing feature and a boost.

The tweet lists November 15, when Fortnite's next update v22.40 is scheduled to go live, meaning it's very likely we'll see the Octane come to battle royale once the update is finished.

The maintenance period for v22.40 is set to begin at 1 AM PT / 4 AM ET on November 15, with matchmaking suspended shortly before the downtime.
